lines.text: Why don't they lock you up with the rest of us? What have you got, a pipeline direct to the big brass?

Why should they lock me up with a group of people who have been fools enough to let themselves get trapped in China? They had plenty of time to get out. I've always lived at this hotel. It's comfortable. I like comfort. Besides, I'm not a citizen of the western nations. I was born in Tangiers. And I am a woman of all countries. With no politics.
No politics?
That's right. I'm not on anybody's team. I'm strictly on my own.
Are you happy that way?
What difference does it make?
I don't think you are. I can see in that.
What else can you see?
I'm not sure. But I think there might be an old dream there.
But it's dying out, is that it?
It does for all of us.
You gotta name?
I gotta whole bunch of 'em... on a police blotter.
This whole thing is... ghastly!
I can think of a better word than that for it.
You can?
An artist, eh? What do you hope to paint around here.
A portrait of despair, perhaps. Human panic.
What are you doing in this crummy part of the world?
Did you forget our curfew law, doctor? No one is allowed on the streets after 7 without a permit. Why did you try to escape?
Is that what I was trying to do?
38 by way of still another alley. Do you like dark, rat-infested alleys, doctor?
Which one did you crawl out of?
You will speak to civil authorities with respect.
A stooge and a Commie!

[Slaps Maynard's face]
You will be held in protective custody.
Just make sure you have someone around to protect you.
